c74object.name: fl.untag~
c74object.digest: Retrieves vectors from a tagged frame according to a specified set of tags
c74object.description: Each output deals with one tag and outputs vectors at the input with that tag. Outputs will be empty if the tag is not present at the input with a vector value. The number of outputs can be set explicitly by parameter. Alternatively, it can be set implicitly by the tag parameters present at instantiation.

entry.name: /num_outs [int]
entry.description:
INSTANTIATION ONLYSets the number of outputs (and hence the number of tags).
(default: 1)

entry.name: /tag_01...10 [string]
entry.description: Sets the tag related to output N [1-10].

objarg.name: tag_01...10
objarg.digest: Sets the tag related to output N [1-10]
objarg.description:
Arguments set parameters tag_01...10:
Sets the tag related to output N [1-10].

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.untag~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.untag~. When set to 0 fl.untag~ forms part of a non-realtime network for performing offline processing in Max message threads. This mode of operation uses buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.untag~ in order to determine distinct processing contexts.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
